FacilityName: Oxy Vinyls, LP - Battleground Chlor-Alkali Plant

_prev_prog_3.Description: Battleground Plant Prevention Program - The facility prevention program encompasses all RMP-covered production units within the Battleground Plant.  These include the Cell Room, Liquefaction Area, Marshalling Yard, and Purification Area.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Oxy Vinyls, LP Battleground facility at La Porte, Texas, is a producer of industrial chemicals.  Oxy Vinyls, LP is a joint venture between OxyChem and the PolyOne Corporation.  OxyChem is the majority owner of Oxy Vinyls, LP.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Stationary Source (? 68.155(a))

OxyVinyls, LP has established a system for the safe operation of the processes at this facility that includes the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances.  One component of this system is a program to manage the risks of accidental releases at the Battleground facility.  This program conforms to the requirements of the Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA's) regulation 40 CFR part 68, Accidental Release Prevention Requirement Risk Management Programs (the RMP rule) and requirements of OSHA 1910.119.  This document is intended to satisfy the RMP plan requirement of the RMP rule and to provide the public with a description of the risk management program at the Battleground facility.

The Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled (? 68.155(b))

The Oxy Vinyls, LP Battleground facility consists of a single chemical production plant that is a joint venture with other companies.  OxyChem operates all plants at the site.  The facility handles three substances that are regulated by the RMP rule.  These substances are as follows:

Ammonia (anhydrous)
Chlorine
Vinyl Chloride

The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Specific Prevention Steps (? 68.155(c))

The Battleground facility?s prevention program has been prepared so that it conforms to both the OSHA Process Safety Management and the EPA Risk Management Plan regulations.  The program consists of the following elements:

Process Safety Information, Process Hazard Analysis, Operating Procedures, Training, Mechanical Integrity, Management of Change, Pre-Startup Review, Compliance Audits, Incident Investigation, Employee Participation, Key Procedures (

including Hot Work Permit), Contractors

Each of the items listed above are documented and maintained in manuals at the facility.  These manuals are routinely updated.

Five-year Accident History (? 68.155(d))

There were not any RMP accidents at this facility in the past 5 years.

Emergency Response Program (? 68.155(e))

The Battleground facility has established a written emergency response plan and maintains an emergency response team (?ERT?) trained in these emergency response procedures.  All plant personnel are trained in evacuation procedures and in-plant drills are conducted periodically.  The drills are used to test the response time of the Emergency Response Team, to test the plant employee accountability program, and to activate the plant's Emergency Operations Center (?EOC?).  In addition, the Battleground facility has developed a Special Situations Plan (?SSP?) which is a program designed for responding to emergencies that may have impacts beyond the immediate plant and is a supplement to the Emergency Response Plan.  The Special Situation Plan links the local response to the OxyChem Corporate Emergency Response Center located in Dallas, Texas.

The facility is a member of the La Porte Area Local Emergency Planning Committee (?LEPC?), which includes industrial and public entities.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety (? 68.155(f))

The Battleground facility constantly tries to improve the safety of the processes through annual reviews of our plant procedures, near misses and incident investigation programs, and a program soliciting safety and environmental suggestions from the plant employees.

Certification Statement

To the best of the undersigned's knowledge, information, and belief formed after reasonable inquiry, the information submitted is true, accurate, and complete.
